Comments: >50% creates risk of settline out (GCH); <100 ppm, CO2 exchange rate approaches zero; must be pressure/temp compensated - set ponit based on std pressure/temp
25 kPa is 30% concentration, set point is earth concentration, given 84 kPa total pressure
1/4 atm (plants can survive) to 1atm (Earth at Sea Level); Add N2 to raise, vent to lower; system limited to ambien plus 0.1 PSI before manometer overflows
Calculated from temp and RH (http://ohioline.osu.edu/aex-fact/0804.html)
Controlled to reach desired VPD
Within maxmum Earth temps; should be measured near plant canopy; cool temps could be used to slow growth
Sources: http://www.weekendgardener.net/vegetables/lettuce.htm and comments from Ray Wheeler; Set point of 23 NASA/TM–2003-211184.

Comments: Downward air flow required, not measured but regulated fan power controls air flow; oxygen sensor requires >3 cc/min flow or 0.0004 m/s across 0.5" membrane (100 cc/min typical)
http://www.weekendgardener.net/vegetables/lettuce.htm
Water boils at 100C at 1atm and ~67C at 1/4atm (sensor); cooler temp also prevents fungal growth
Sources: http://www.howardresh.com/Hydroponic-Lettuce-Production1.html says 18-21 C. Use 23 as a 'set point' NASA/TM–2003-211184; cornell lettuce handbook says 24-26

Comments: 1150-1250 above source water (plant). 3 -3000 is distilled water to a margin above lettuce maximum
Nitrate + Ammonium

Sources: http://www.cornellcea.com/attachments/Cornell%20CEA%20Lettuce%20Handbook%20.pdf. Ray et Al give 5 - 6.5 as ideal.
